Posts.Title: Post Surgery Bras!!

Posts.Content: hey Jules,  well done for getting through the surgery - in my opinion (and everyone has different experiences) the worst is now over for you - i hope so anyway.  i am a teacher of small children, and did not return to work throughout my chemo. this did stress me out, as i was actually feeling perfectly fine to be there - but i kept away as i was worried about catching nasty bugs from the kids etc and did not want to miss any chemos through illness. it really depends on your job and how you are feeling - it may be good to do just mornings, or just afternoons - you never know how you will feel.  i am back at work now after 5 months off - and thank god - i was going insane with boredom!! i am starting RT in about 4 weeks ish and intend to work throughout  (luckily, the hopsital is about 5 mins from my house - so i can get there easily for the daily RT sessions). however, i heard that you can feel tired and maybe sore - so i will have to cross that bridge when i come to it.  stay positive though - and if you do have to take time off work - find a good hobby to keep you occupied! i bought a sewing machine and have created all manner of lovely items - it really keep me motivated! good luck to you anyway - hopefully your chemo will be finished by november and your holiday - so you can have a really lovely celebration. take care and rest up xx :)

Posts.Title: Radiotherapy

Posts.Content: hey Siklady,  I have had the cold cap and it worked for me. I began FEC in december and finished on march 30th and I still had hair at the end. I had really long hair and was desperate to keep it. I had my first FEC on 13th Dec and my hair began falling out properly on NYE - and i had it cut to chin length  - against my will I might add!! On about the 6th Jan, after my 2nd chemo, I reluctantly had my hair chopped off to a crop do, like the one in my pic. My hair is still the same as this and having short hair, defo made the hair loss easier to cope with. I guess I am one of the lucky ones  in that respect, as I am certainly not as brave as those who cope with severe hairloss. So, i would say - try it  - take those pain killers before see how you go....you never know! on the whole exercise front, I am like you - I love going to the gym and was gutted that this whole experience would mean that I could not continue. I stopped my gym membership after the first op on the lymph nodes as was worried about using my arm and hurting myself further. I also had a PICC line, which meant no swimming. Throughout the chemo, I tried hard to go walking every day. Now it is practically all over, I am excited about re-joining the gym and being able to go spinning again, swimming  etc, although I imagine it will still be a while until I get to do body pump or running  -since I only had the op 2 weeks ago!! Everyone is different though, the chemo did not really wipe me out too much and i was able to continue as normal - but for other people it has. A positive attitude definitely saw me through it all and I always say that with a positive attitude you can conquer anything. Going to  the gym and keeping active sounds like it will help you out massively, so I really hope that you can continue and there really is no reason why you should not - just don;t tire yourself out too much! Loads of luck with everything - you'll be fine :)) xxx

Posts.Content: Hey clair,  how are you doing? Glad the hair is doing well - mine is growing soooo much now  - obviously, it is still short, but some days i go out and all my new growth is sticking up through the longer hairs, it's hilarious!! uncontrollable!! my hair has gone quite wavy, which at first i thought was cool, but now I am not too sure...so i have been using my straighteners trying to tame it, although all my friends have been telling me off! i did use a hairdryer once, but the outcome was absolutely hilarious and i went about all day with some horrific bouffant with sticky up hair and spiky regrowth!!!! i have no idea when it is ok to start using all those products again, i had my hair cut once to get rid of 'the bush' mullet that had formed where the patchy hair loss was, but am now trying to last until after my holiday as i have a wedding and want it to look really fab and nicely styled for that! Posts.Title: hair strength after cold cap...advice??!!

Posts.Content: hey jane,  sorry just replying to this as well... both me and clair had the cold cap and it seems that it worked well for both of us. i had really long hair and had it but to chin length after my first chemo.
